DOC.criteria: Men nonpregnant/lactating woman age 18 45 . Body Mass Index ( BMI ) ≥18 ≤30 Participants able give write informed consent willing comply studyrelated procedure . Known clinically manifest atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease , include coronary disease , cerebrovascular disease , peripheral vascular disease History diabetes mellitus Fasting glucose > 126mg/dL screen History nonskin malignancy within previous 5 year Renal insufficiency define creatinine outside lab define normal range eGFR < 60 ml/Kg/min Screening Visit History liver disease abnormal Liver Function Tests ( LFTs ) ( aspartate aminotransferase ( AST ) , alanine transaminase ( ALT ) , alkaline phosphatase , gammaglutamyl transpeptidase ( GGT ) > 1.5x upper limit normal ( ULN ) ; bilirubin > 2x ULN ) Screening Visit Men unwilling limit alcohol consumption < 14 alcoholic drink per week < 4 alcoholic drink per occasion ( American Medical Association/National Institute Alcohol Abuse Alcoholism ( AMA / NIAAA ) criteria `` risk '' usage level ) participate study Women unwilling limit alcohol consumption < 7 alcoholic drink per week < 3 alcoholic drink per occasion ( AMA / NIAAA criterion `` risk '' usage level ) participate study Total white blood cell count less equal 3.0 THO/uL Hemoglobin le 11.0 g/dL Any major active rheumatologic , pulmonary , dermatologic disease inflammatory condition minor active infection Selfreported history HIV positive First degree family history premature cardiovascular disease event ( father brother diagnose 55 year age ; mother sister diagnose 65 year age ) Patients undergone organ transplant Individuals currently use tobacco product do previous 30 day Treatment aspirin , Nonsteroidal Antiinflammatory Drugs ( NSAIDs ) , cyclooxygenase2 ( COX2 ) inhibitor , steroid immunomodulatory therapy 2 week prior Screening Visit Treatment statins , fibrates niacin 4 week prior Screening Visit . Current daily use Vitamin C > 1000 mg , Beta carotene > 1000 IU , vitamin A > 5000 IU , vitamin E > 400 IU , selenium > 200 mcg Participants unwilling eliminate omega3 fatty acid ( eicosapentaenoic acid ( EPA ) + docosahexaenoic acid ( DHA ) ) supplement and/or fortify food , usual intake high omega3 fish ( tuna nonfried fish ) > 3 4 serving per month assess simple screening questionnaire Positive urine pregnancy test result . Participation another clinical trial within previous 6 week prior Screening Visit . Poorly control blood pressure ( BP > 160/110 ) antihypertensive medication . A diagnosis metabolic syndrome use updated 2004 National Cholesterol Education Program Adult Treatment Panel III ( NCEP ATPIII ) criterion .
